page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY--CHURCHES
page.content: {THE CHURCH OF ST. JOHN THE EVANGELIST} Built in 1887, one of the first churches to use concrete construction methods. Contains much fine wood and stone carvings also pulpit and cadelabra of interest. {THE OLD CHURCHYARD SWARRATON} Map Reference 568367 Abandoned churchyard. Some graves remaining. GILBERT WHITE once curate according to G.H.HUDSON in his book HAMPSHIRE DAYS. {THE OLD CHURCHYARD NORTHINGTON} Map Reference 564374 Partly car park for ST. JOHN'S. Demolished circa 1887. Vault and gravestones remain. Marked by memorial cross to BARING family. {OLIVER'S BATTERY, ABBOTSTONE DOWN} Map Reference 585363 Ancient fortified position.
